senses.definition: a' A negative answer to a question or suggestion is one that says 'no'.
example: She got a totally negative response to her idea. [j33] So far I've had six negative replies and four have said they can come

note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is positive.

senses.definition: ' If you neglect something, you don't pay as much attention to it as you ought to.
example: He neglected his studies, and so failed his exams. 2 ' '[cf2]verb If you neglect someone or something, you don't look after  them properly.  [cf2]The children were neglected for days at a time while the couple went out drinking. [j33] I've neglected the garden for months. 3 ' '[cf2]verb In formal language, if you neglect to do something, you fail to do it.  You don't do it, probably because you have forgotten about it or don't know that you should do it.  [cf2]I'm afraid I neglected to feed the cat this morning. [j33] Several students neglected to hand in their assignments on time
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun neglect' The buildings are suffering from neglect.

definition: A negligee is a woman's dressing gown that is very flimsy and feminine in style.

definition: If someone is negligent, they don't take enough care over what they are supposed to be doing.

definition: If something is negligible, it is so small or slight that it is hardly worth considering.
